#summary common Prolog examples gambolized

=== Sum all the Numbers in a List ===

{{{
(*- (sumlist () 0))
(*- (sumlist (?head . ?tail) ?n)
    (sumlist ?tail ?n1)
    (is ?n (lop (+ ?n1 ?head))))
(?- (sumlist (1 2 3 4 5) ?n))
}}}

=== Towers of Hanoi ===

{{{
(*- (move 1 ?x ?y ??)
    (lisp (format t "Move top disk from ~A to ~A.~%" '?x '?y)))
(*- (move ?n ?x ?y ?z)
    (lop (> ?n 1))
    (is ?m (lop (- ?n 1)))
    (move ?m ?x ?z ?y)
    (move 1 ?x ?y ??)
    (move ?m ?z ?y ?x))
(?- (move 3 left right center))
}}}

=== Blow your Stack: Fibonacci Numbers ===

A naive implementation â€”

{{{
(*- (fib 0 1))
(*- (fib 1 1))
(*- (fib ?n ?f)
    (lop (> ?n 1))
    (is ?n1 (lop (1- ?n)))
    (is ?n2 (lop (- ?n 2)))
    (fib ?n1 ?f1)
    (fib ?n2 ?f2)
    (is ?f (lop (+ ?f1 ?f2))))
(?- (fib 10 ?f))
}}}
